intro: Baeria chrysostoma var. macrantha, commonly known as the golden crown bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms. The variety macrantha distinguishes it from other forms of Baeria chrysostoma by its larger, more prominent flowers.
